Document.Focus: Anomalous left coronary artery from the pulmonary artery

Synonyms.Synonym: Anomalous origin of the left coronary artery arising from the pulmonary artery

QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Anomalous left coronary artery from the pulmonary artery
QAPair.Answer: Anomalous left coronary artery from the pulmonary artery (ALCAPA) is a heart defect. The left coronary artery (LCA), which carries blood to the heart muscle, begins from the pulmonary artery instead of the aorta. ALCAPA is present at birth (congenital) .
